msItem.author: Hugh of St. Cher
msItem.title: Postillae in Bibliam (Isaiah)
msItem.explicit: sub planta pedum vestrorum. Deo gracias. Laus honor et gloria Iesu.

msItem.author: Jean de la Rochelle
msItem.title: Postille super Danielem
msItem.note: Stegmüller, Rep. biblicum, no.4896, here wrongly attributed to Hugh of St. Cher. A copy is also found in the Exeter College set of Hugo de Vienna (MS.61).
msItem.rubric: Postille super Danielem secundum Hugonem de Wienna autentice
msItem.incipit: Optavi et datus est michi sensus…Sap. vii. Ex verbis istis
Danielem prophetam etc. Huic libro premittit Ieronimus prologum
msItem.explicit: Daniel commedit.Deo gracias. Laus honor et gloria Iesu.
msItem.colophon: Finitur per me Matheum de Moravia diocesis Olomuncensis cuius metropolis civitas regalis Pragensis Sub anno domini Millesimo CCCC lvj. O myla O ma myla cisarsofno gedna.

msItem.author: Ps.-Hugh of Saint-Cher
msItem.title: Commentary on the Apocalypse
msItem.incipit: Vidit Iacob scalam. Gen.xxviii. Quatuor sunt cause
msItem.explicit: quicquid viderit corrigendum. Benedictus sit Iesus. Amen. Laus honor et gloria Iesu.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Hugonis de Wyenna doctoris fidelissimi autenticus super Apocalipsim Iesu Christi.
msItem.colophon: Et finitur per me Matheum de Moravia nacionis Germanorum diocesis Olomuncensis cuius metropolis Pragensis Anno gratie millesimo CCCC lv in profesto Marci Evangeliste.

supportDesc.support: parchment noticeably white (p. 750 called by the scribe ‘malum velin per totum’, p. 395 ‘carta pessima et abiecta’)
supportDesc.collation: 1(12)–34(12), 33(6) 1–25 are signed θ, a-z (omitting u, w), 7; 26–35 are signed a-k

decoDesc.summary: Pächt and Alexander iii. 1056, pl. XCVIII:
decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated initials at beginning of each work, blue, rose, green and orange acanthus leaves, picked out with white, on a gold ground, with ivy leaf floriation on inner and upper margin, English work (that on p.601 is reproduced in Bodleian Library, Annual Report of the Curators, 1951–2, 1951–2, facing p.9).
At beginnings of chapters blue initials flourished with red, lemmata underlined in red

physDesc.additions: There are a few marginalia partly taken over from the exemplar (e.g.pp.711sqq., 732sqq.) and partly by a contemporary reader (e.g.pp.745, 748).

binding.p: Contemporary sheep-skin binding, originally pink, with one clasp remaining.

history.provenance: Written by Matheus de Moravia of the diocese of Olomouc (Olmütz), p. 827: see the references given in B.L.R. IV, (1953) 341

Inscription, p. 829, concerning the price of parchment, writing, decoration, etc.: ‘Hic liber continet in se in toto li quaternos et quilibet quaternus continet in se viij folia precium uniuscuiusque quaterni pro scriptura xld. et pro velin uniuscuiusque quaterni viijd.et pro ligatura et illuminatura xxiijs.viijd. Summa totalis huius xj li.vjs. viijd.’
history.acquisition: Quaritch, cat. 699 (1952), item 56; purchased by the Bodleian

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian Library staff, revised by Peter Kidd, late 1990s

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: A. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts in Oxford Libraries (1984), no. 566

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
